elements.title: β-C−H bond functionalization of ketones and esters by cationic Pd complexes
elements.contents:
β-C−H bond functionalization of ketones and esters by cationic Pd complexes

Diverse methyl β-C−H functionalizations of ketones and esters are enabled by cationic Pd(II) complexes with MPANA ligands, offering access to spirocyclic and fused ring systems through enhanced catalyst–substrate affinity.

  • Yi-Hao Li
  • Nikita Chekshin
  • Jin-Quan Yu
Article08 Jan 2025

elements.title: Heritable polygenic editing: the next frontier in genomic medicine?
elements.contents:
Heritable polygenic editing: the next frontier in genomic medicine?

We discuss the potential consequences and ethical concerns of polygenic genome editing of human embryos to alter specific variants associated with polygenic diseases, highlighting the possibility of reducing disease susceptibility while exacerbating health inequalities.

  • Peter M. Visscher
  • Christopher Gyngell
  • Julian Savulescu
AnalysisOpen Access08 Jan 2025

elements.title: Hippocampal neuronal activity is aligned with action plans
elements.contents:
Hippocampal neuronal activity is aligned with action plans

Using high-density electrophysiological recordings, how internally generated cell assemblies are updated by action plans to meet external goals is explored.

  • Ipshita Zutshi
  • Athina Apostolelli
  • György Buzsáki
Article08 Jan 2025

elements.title: Bidirectional histone monoaminylation dynamics regulate neural rhythmicity
elements.contents:
Bidirectional histone monoaminylation dynamics regulate neural rhythmicity

TG2 functions as an eraser and exchanger of H3 monoaminylations, including histaminylation of Gln5 of histone H3.

  • Qingfei Zheng
  • Benjamin H. Weekley
  • Ian Maze
ArticleOpen Access08 Jan 2025

elements.title: Janus graphene nanoribbons with localized states on a single zigzag edge
elements.contents:
Janus graphene nanoribbons with localized states on a single zigzag edge

Janus graphene nanoribbons with localized states on a single zigzag edge are fabricated by introducing a topological defect array of benzene motifs on the opposite zigzag edge, to break the structural symmetry.

  • Shaotang Song
  • Yu Teng
  • Jiong Lu
Article08 Jan 2025

elements.title: Conformational protection of molybdenum nitrogenase by Shethna protein II
elements.contents:
Conformational protection of molybdenum nitrogenase by Shethna protein II

A small ferredoxin (Shethna protein II) of Azotobacter vinelandii can provide protection from O2 stress that may be crucial for the maintenance of recombinant nitrogenase in food crops.

  • Philipp Franke
  • Simon Freiberger
  • Oliver Einsle
ArticleOpen Access08 Jan 2025

elements.title: A rare PRIMER cell state in plant immunity
elements.contents:
A rare PRIMER cell state in plant immunity

The development of a molecularly defined spatiotemporal atlas of pathogen-infected Arabidopsis thaliana leaves reveals specific cell states that have distinct roles in plant immunity.

  • Tatsuya Nobori
  • Alexander Monell
  • Joseph R. Ecker
ArticleOpen Access08 Jan 2025

elements.title: Satellite DNA shapes dictate pericentromere packaging in female meiosis
elements.contents:
Satellite DNA shapes dictate pericentromere packaging in female meiosis

Divergent satellite DNA shapes influence architectural protein binding and chromatin organization in two mouse species so that the satellites can be packaged and centromere function maintained, mitigating the evolutionary cost of satellite DNA expansion.

  • Damian Dudka
  • Jennine M. Dawicki-McKenna
  • Ben E. Black
Article08 Jan 2025

elements.title: Functional evaluation and clinical classification of BRCA2 variants
elements.contents:
Functional evaluation and clinical classification of BRCA2 variants

Results from a comprehensive evaluation of the function of BRCA2 variants, particularly variants of uncertain significance, provide a useful resource to improve the clinical management of individuals who carry such genetic variants.

  • Huaizhi Huang
  • Chunling Hu
  • Fergus J. Couch
ArticleOpen Access08 Jan 2025

elements.title: How frictional ruptures and earthquakes nucleate and evolve
elements.contents:
How frictional ruptures and earthquakes nucleate and evolve

Experimental and theoretical evidence shows that incorporating finite interface widths extends fracture mechanics to include crack (and earthquake) nucleation; slow steady creep occurring at a well-defined stress threshold.

  • Shahar Gvirtzman
  • David S. Kammer
  • Jay Fineberg
Article08 Jan 2025

elements.title: Meta-analysis reveals global variations in plant diversity effects on productivity
elements.contents:
Meta-analysis reveals global variations in plant diversity effects on productivity

A meta-analysis of biodiversity effects on plant productivity found that complementarity effects increased over time whereas selection effects decreased, and both remained consistent across global variations in climate.

  • Chen Chen
  • Wenya Xiao
  • Han Y. H. Chen
Article08 Jan 2025

elements.title: Dynamic supramolecular snub cubes
elements.contents:
Dynamic supramolecular snub cubes

Left- and right-handed snub cubes show photocontrollable elasticity and hardness, in addition to the ability to encapsulate different small molecules in distinct compartments simultaneously, with potential applications in the development of advanced biomimetic materials.

  • Huang Wu
  • Yu Wang
  • J. Fraser Stoddart
Article08 Jan 2025

elements.title: Host metabolism balances microbial regulation of bile acid signalling
elements.contents:
Host metabolism balances microbial regulation of bile acid signalling

A family of host-derived bile acid–methylcysteamine conjugates functions as FXR antagonists, forming part of a microbiota-dependent metabolic network that regulates FXR-dependent physiology.

  • Tae Hyung Won
  • Mohammad Arifuzzaman
  • Frank C. Schroeder
Article08 Jan 2025

elements.title: Li2ZrF6-based electrolytes for durable lithium metal batteries
elements.contents:
Li2ZrF6-based electrolytes for durable lithium metal batteries

Adding excess m-Li2ZrF6 (monoclinic) nanoparticles to a commercial LiPF6-containing carbonate electrolyte forms a stable interphase rich in t-Li2ZrF6 (trigonal), enhancing Li-ion transfer, suppressing dendrite growth and considerably improving the cycling stability of high-rate lithium metal batteries.

  • Qingshuai Xu
  • Tan Li
  • Yongcai Qiu
Article08 Jan 2025

elements.title: The sequence–structure–function relationship of intrinsic ERα disorder
elements.contents:
The sequence–structure–function relationship of intrinsic ERα disorder

Serine 118 phosphorylation drives conformational changes through the disruption of hydrophobic interactions between aromatic-rich clusters, showing how hydrophobic mutations can restore oestrogen receptor-mediated transcription.

  • Zhanwen Du
  • Han Wang
  • Sichun Yang
ArticleOpen Access08 Jan 2025
